title: U.S. Builds New Firewall to Stop Spread of Militant Islamists
description: Hundreds of American troops join Western allies in Niger to block al Qaeda and Islamic State from advancing violence and influence in West Africa. “I don’t know that I’d call them winning. I‘d certainly say they’re holding.”

title: Lockerbie Bombing Suspect Is in U.S. Custody
description: The Libyan explosives expert is believed by U.S. and U.K. authorities to have constructed the explosive device used to destroy a commercial jetliner over Scotland in 1988.

title: China Props Up Belt-and-Road Borrowers Via Unusual Channel
description: The People’s Bank of China has used currency-swap lines to support governments that borrowed heavily from Chinese banks.

title: Iran's Islamic Leaders Face a Crisis of Faith as Protests Swell
description: Demonstrations against core values underpinning the Islamic system suggest the country might be heading away from a conservative path.

title: How Washington Persuaded Europe to Put a Price Cap on Russian Oil
description: President Biden and senior advisers, in last-minute negotiations with world leaders, secured support for a novel plan that aims to keep Russian oil on global markets while limiting the Kremlin’s revenues from sales.

title: Russian Drone Strikes Leave Most of Odessa Without Power
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said 1.5 million people in the region were without power, with only critical infrastructure connected to the power grid.
